result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Bodily Harm or Threat to Employee of Health Care Facility or Family

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah I Norman

records.addlTxt: Received and filed: Justice Point VIOLATION Report ( missed office contact).

Defendant Jeremiah I Norman appeared by video.  
Attorney Theodore O'Reilly for Sylvan Jaspen in court for Jeremiah I Norman.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Bail Bond Hearing.
Court informed defense counsel in trial in a different court and request an adjournment.
Court ordered case adjourned back to Branch 19.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.

Defendant Jeremiah I Norman appeared by video.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Jeremiah I Norman.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on vacation.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.

Defendant Jeremiah I Norman in court, in custody.  
Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Jeremiah I Norman. 
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for return on doctors report. Court reviews doctor's report with the parties.  
State, defense counsel and defendant are not challenging the findings of the doctor's report.
Court  adopts the professional opinion of the examiner's that the defendant does not lack substantial capacity to understand the proceedings or aid in his defense. 
Court finds defendant competent and reinstates the proceedings.  
Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing before Preliminary Court. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 7.22.22

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Jeremiah I Norman not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for status. Imposed and stayed bench warrant is cancelled. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.     
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7.20.22
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7.20.22

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Jeremiah I Norman not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Mr Norman possibly in custody at a local district. Court will impose, but stay a warrant until the next date and ordered case adjourned for CAUSE.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report

JusticePoint PreTrial Services VIOLATION Report dated July 5, 2022; received and filed.
Legal - New Criminal Charges were filed resulting in Case 22CF2490. 
Defendant IN CUSTODY.

Court ordered no contact with C.D.F, S.S.G, C.L.J and S.S.W
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jeremiah I Norman in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Jeremiah I Norman in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
 This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
